items.sentence: I wonder who the next president of the United States will be.
I wondered whether or not Tom thought Mary needed to do that.
I wondered whether or not Tom thought Mary wanted to do that.
I wondered whether or not Tom wanted to go to Boston with us.
Both Mary and Alice were wearing short skirts and high heels.
Can you please tell me where the nearest public telephone is?
I know him by sight, but I have never actually spoken to him.
I still have a lot of work I need to do before I can go home.
I want to find out if Tom is going to go out and eat with us.
I wanted to tell Tom in person, so I drove over to his house.
Tom and Mary will probably not tell John about what they did.
Tom appears to be too tired to tackle that problem right now.
Tom asked Mary if she was planning to go to Boston with John.
I\'m pretty sure Tom didn\'t know I wasn\'t going to do that.
Tom doesn\'t quite get it. Could you explain it to him again?
How much do you pay each year for your children\'s education?
Tom should\'ve known better than to call Mary after midnight.
Explain yourself clearly so that you won\'t be misunderstood.
Tom must\'ve been the one who added Mary\'s name to the list.
Tom didn\'t tell me that he didn\'t have a driver\'s license.
